metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0067 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In f2fs_xattr_generic_list of xattr.c, there is a possible out of boundsread due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local informationdisclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is notrequired for exploitation.Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel.Android ID: A-120551147.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-aws - 4.4.0-1078.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1089-azure - 4.15.0-1089.99~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.82').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1089.99~14.04.1').
